Leave It To Beaver Season 1 (1957)
S01E11 Beaver&#039;s Short Pants, S01E12 The Perfume Salesmen

S01E11 Beaver&#039;s Short Pants
First aired: 12/13/1957 
When June goes on a trip to visit her sister Peggy, June&#039;s Aunt Martha steps in and stays with Ward and the boys. Ward and the boys do their best not to hurt Martha&#039;s feelings but Beaver has the hardest time, when she buys him a suit, kneesocks, a cap and short pants and makes him wear the outfit to school.
Cast: Hugh Beaumont (Ward Cleaver), Barbara Billingsley (June Cleaver), Tony Dow (Wally Cleaver), Jerry Mathers (Theodore "Beaver" Cleaver)
Guest cast: Rusty Stevens (Larry Mondello), Jeri Weil (Judy Hensler), Madge Kennedy (Aunt Martha) ,William Schallert (Mr. Bloomgarten), Eric Snowden (Clothier)

S01E12 The Perfume Salesmen
First aired: 12/27/1957 
Wally and Beaver want to win a fancy film projector and in order to get it they have to sell 24 bottles of perfume. However, the appalling aroma of the perfume, which smells like an old catcher&#039;s mitt, quickly leads to zero sales and has Ward trying to think up a sales gimmick.
Cast: Hugh Beaumont (Ward Cleaver), Barbara Billingsley (June Cleaver), Tony Dow (Wally Cleaver), Jerry Mathers (Theodore "Beaver" Cleaver)
Guest cast: Anne Dore (Mrs. Wentworth), Helen Jay (Customer)
